data.title: Beautiful, intimate space
data.text: The Merrill Auditorium seems to be a perfect blend of size and coziness.  It is a beautiful building also.

data.title: Lovely venue
data.text: Such a nice place to see a performance, architecturally stunning, helpful friendly staff, comfy seats, wonderful acoustics. Currently doing some sort of renovation/construction around the entrance that was annoying, a bit tough for those with mobility issues. Two parking lots nearby. Worth  a visit.

data.title: Wonderful Concert Hall
data.text: My wife and I attended a concert of organ and brass, featuring the magnificent Kotzchmar Organ. The concert was well attended although not full, we enjoyed the music very much and the following day we got a guided tour through the organ after which I got an opportunity to play it - that was one of the highlights of our visit.

data.title: One Weekend - Two Shows
data.text: We got tickets to two shows at the Merrill Auditorium the weekend we spent in Portland.  It is a beautiful old concert and the two shows and each experience could not have been more different.  Our first show was “Straight No Chaser” which was the BEST.  The second was “Capital Steps” which was not the best.  SNC is an a cappella group and their performance was delightful.  The CS was a satire performance on the political situation and we did not enjoy them as much – plus where we were seated was very warm and stuffy throughout the performance.  Depending on the performance we would attend again.

data.title: Bob Marley
data.text: Great seating, lighting was good, and you could hear the comedians very well. The architecture is beautiful inside. I now get regular emails with updates of new performers to be informed.

data.title: Wonderful Venue for "Magical Christmas"
data.text:
We attended this season's Magical Christmas Concert at the Merrill Auditorium. The acoustics were excellent and the sight lines great from many vantage points. The seats were comfortable. The interior has been restored and well cared for. Everyone in our group felt that the Merrill offered a great intimate setting for the concert.

The best concert venue in Portland!

data.title: Great Venue

data.title: See a Show or Tour the Kotzschmar Organ
data.text:
I can't say how many hours I've enjoyed experiencing various performances in Merrill Auditorium over the years. From the symphony, opera, rock, musicals, comedy shows, and more, there's always a huge variety of stuff programmed throughout the year. It's a rather comfortable venue, though tall people should probably avoid the first rows of the balconies. There's a good amount of stair climbing to access the center sections of the second balcony, though it is all served by an elevator.

For best sound, I would recommend not going too deep into the first balcony (Grand Tier) or anywhere in the back of the ground floor (Terrace) as these spots are covered by the seating above them. Visuals are generally good throughout, though the seats in the balconies have much better vertical spacing compared to the Orchestra/Terrace seats on the ground floor.

If you're around when the Kotzschmar Organ is open for tours, I highly recommend a trip in. It takes about an hour and a half, starting with a demo of the organ. Following that, docents take small groups inside the organ (yes, you go inside it, it's that big). You will visit the inside of the air chest, which is the primary cavity that gets pressurized to feed the valves of the pipes during its operation. They will explain what you're seeing and how it works. After that they'll take you up behind the facade to see some of its pipes, which are attached to the top of the air chest you were just in. I thought it was fascinating to see and I highly recommend it for any music lover or mechanically curious person. The tour was free, though there was a donation box for those inclined to help support this magnificent instrument.

data.title: Mamma Mia
data.text: I attend shows and concerts  at Merrill Auditorium several times a year and always enjoy fantastic music and entertainment.

data.title: A wonderful venue
data.text: We recently got last minute tickets to the Auditorium to view Celtic Thunder's tour there - even though they were in the balcony, the view was excellent, and I doubt there is a bad seat in the house.  The acoustics are as grand as the decor, and the seating is quite comfortable.  Those with walking difficulties would do well to either arrive early and ask for seating on the outer edges of the balcony (there is only one elevator up) or stick to the main terrace level, where the main restrooms are located (the ones on the fourth floor / balcony section 2/3 require going up a short flight of stairs).

data.title: The most beautiful venue...
data.text: I've been to dozens of shows at Merrill since moving to Portland in 1980. The building was completely restored a number of years ago. It is truly a sight to behold. The acoustics and site lines are top notch. The staff is friendly. Highly recommended.

data.title: Been here for music shows for both adults and kids
data.text: I have been here for major concerts as well as for kids shows, and I absolutely adore this place.  The accoustics are excellent, and even the concession choices were excellent downstairs.  If you have time to walk around the building, do so, talk about marvelous architecture.

data.title: Great concert space
data.text: The auditorium is build to let the sound fill the auditorium. There are three levels. They do have an elevator to the balcony and third tier. Once we got to the balcony, we found there were lots of steps to get to the level of our seats on the balcony. If you have problems with steps, I suggest you get a first floor seat, if possible.
